It seems you have no email clients installed :(

• Worked on multiple projects to improve and maintain the company's in-house APIs and frameworks. 

• Security team member, responsible for the security framework evolution as well as the development of automated solutions for security testing and auditing. 

• Developed a Maven plugin for integration with the OWASP ZAP security tool. 

Technologies involved: Java, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, MySQL, build (Maven, Gradle), testing (JUnit, TestNG, Mockito), and continuous integration (Jenkins, SonarQube) frameworks and tools.

Worked on the development and maintenance of the company\'s ERP systems related to academic activities, human resources and administration management. \n\nTechnologies involved: J2EE, JBoss 4.2.2, JSF 1.2, RichFaces, EJB 2, Spring, Hibernate, PostgreSQL, JasperReports.

Manolos was a startup company created by me and two friends. We started developing Android applications, including the three most popular apps on Google Play related to our university. We then worked on several native mobile applications to extend and improve local business solutions. \n\nTechnologies involved: Java, Android, Swift, iOS.
Lab Intern @ Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte

• Worked in the Industrial Computing Laboratory to develop software products - mainly based on Java Swing applications - to analyze the operation and management of industrial plants. 

• Published a paper on the Brazilian Symposium on Intelligent Automation (SBAI 2013) and two more on the Brazilian Conference on Automation (CBA 2014). 

Technologies involved: Java, Swing, JFreeChart, Java RMI, PostgreSQL.

• Research and development project to create a hardware prototype of a communication modem to perform wireless data transmission in the ocean. 

• The prototype was built on a low-power applications processor based on an ARM and a DSP core, where most modulation algorithms were developed using the DSP Library by Texas Instruments. 

• Presented a poster on the International Conference on Underwater Networks and Systems in Los Angeles, CA, and at the University of Delaware Research Foundation poster session.
